name: Le Chateau de Cocove

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dirty bedroom and bathroom. Ants! No customer feedback. attempts. Staff poorly trained and reception not interested in complaint. Restaurant -ok but not up to usual french standards. At 100 Euro stay clear!
reviews.title: A very bad experience.
Beautiful building, excellent food but very tired and poorly maintained rooms

likes.liked: — The quality of the food in the evening was excellent, though a little pricey
likes.disliked: — Very poorly maintained/ decorated rooms and attitude/ training problems with staff

reviews.title: Lovely place, tired rooms. Food quite good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked two rooms for a single night stay (in order to squeeze in a little shopping on our way back to the UK from Belgium).
reviews.title: Really loved it...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whilst the chateau building itself is lovely (and the gardens too are pleasant) the rooms are a huge disappointment given the prices charged.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay

likes.liked: — The convenience and tanquility of the area.
likes.disliked: — The bathroom was antiquated, the shower would not fit in the holder and had to be held and the shower itself was just a basin in the floor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we arrived on 30th May 2008 and were given room number 11 well it was truly depressing ver y worn everything and horrendous wallpaper just very worn and dated. We complained and said we werent happy with this room and were moved to room 1 which was marginally better so we took it. The food I have to say was very good we had a bottle of champagne and on returning ro our room it looked better !!!!!!! None of the staff we came across bothered to speak English andseemed quite uninterested in genereal.We wouldnt go there again as it wasnt the end we had wanted to our holiday
reviews.title: awfull room

likes.disliked: — worn out everything and miserable staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Though we now live in the States, we still have homes in the UK and France and this past March 2008 we returned to the Chateau de Cocove after not having stayed there in 7 years. The last time we stayed there we had a very large room in the old part of the chateau - shabby chic at it's best. This time I wasn't sure what we would get as we paid a rate lower than we had 7 years previously....we were in a much smaller but delighthful room with upholstered walls and ceilings in a new wing. The bathroom could use better ventilation and more bleach and elbow grease, but I adore the Chateau de Cocove and there is NO better place to stay if you are crossing over by ferry or chunnel between countries. The food is great ....a perfect French meal and service, the wine if very hgh priced but if you save on your hotel by checking all the websites and booking smart (we only paid USD$55.00 for our room!) you don't mind that the meal costs so much more than the room!! We used to cross back and forth all the time and we never found a nicer place to stay!! The entire experience - if you have a meal there - is worth 5 stars. Perhaps 3.5 - 4 stars if you do not eat there - but that is why you stay at the Chateau de Cocove!
reviews.title: Alwys the the Chateau de cocove

likes.liked: — Great restaurant and great localtion to chunnel!

reviews.title: Loved the Chateau
reviews.text: Having read the recent reviews I was a bit concerned about our forthcoming stay. However I had nothing to worry about - our room was lovely the food was fantastic and the staff were lovely. I'd definitely stay there again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After 9 years of visiting this hotel I think now is the time for a change. The room whilst always of the "faded glory" type are now well past their prime. Some have been renovated and these rooms seem OK. This year however we took our dog and were allocated a ground floor room. The room was tatty, not that clean and the bathroom was awful. Tiles were chipped and mouldy. The floor corners were mouldy and the overall impression was of unkempt.
reviews.title: Time for us to change I think

likes.disliked: — Rooms, bathrooms and same old menu

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love the location, we have always liked the food (although we agree time is now due for a change of menu) and we have always managed with our room. This time however the bathroom did it for us.
reviews.title: Could do with an overhaul!

likes.liked: — The restaurant and bar, the rural setting, pretty grounds
likes.disliked: — Run down bedrooms need some t.l.c. + rooms need new bathrooms

aka: Le Chateau De Cocove Hotel Recques-Sur-Hem
